newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary Nov PPI down to 1.1pct m/m, 19.7 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Hungary Nov PPI down to 1.1pct m/m, 19.7 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Hungary November producer prices rose by 1.1 percent from the previous month and were up 19.7 percent from a year ago, the Central Statistics Office (KSH) said in a statement on Friday. In October, the monthly rise was 1.6 percent while the year-on-year rise was 20.0 percent.
NOTE - Domestic sales prices rose an average 1.2 percent per month over the last three months, an average bettered only in the summer months of June and July, the statistical office said.
Mining industrial price levels were up 1.1 percent in November, compared to 1.6 percent in October.
Prices rose by 1.3 percent in the food, beverage and tobacco industry, compared to 2.5 percent on October, and by 2.6 percent in the chemicals industry, after 2.3 percent on the previous month.
Semi-finished goods saw a November rise of 1.3 percent, the statistical office said, while textiles, clothing and leather roses of 1.7 percent.
